ygData.messageBody:
Ryan Honeyman wrote:

> > Problem 4: For some reason, most Enchanters I've grouped with are total
> > jackasses. They are constantly barking orders (usually in all caps) and
> > yelling at everybody.
>
> This is because people are idiots. In general, you can assume that
> the other 5 people you are playing with know nothing about their own
> skills let alone your skills. Last night in a group with an enchanter,
> two bards, a druid and me (a druid). I got to see the other side of
> the fence. Enchanters have it rough, they are the groups master control
> center. They and the cleric control the groups movement, battle
> actions, plans, etc. The two bards would not assist each other and
> insisted on fighting multiple enemies during the same encounter.

I got some decent exp in Sol B Saturday and Sunday (6 bubbles, 1 death). I did not have an enchanter in
the group, so whatever crowd control we had fell to me. We had to handle multiple MOBs several times
(four at once a couple of times, seven in succession a couple of times) and we did rather well, but we
could have done better. How? If the other players had LISTENED TO ME WHEN I SAID TO TARGET ONE MOB OR TO
/ASSIST XYZ. (sorry about the caps, Harm). They didn't, probably because I'm just too gosh-darned polite
about it. If I had been dying as a result of this, I would have started to yell, myself. If people
continue to be clueless despite repeated polite nudgings, you have to HIT THEM ON THE HEAD.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 38 songs, Innoruuk
